Definition: Given a conversation between a user and a system, identify who has spoken the indicated sentence.

Positive Examples.input: Sentence1:i need a place to dine in the center thats expensive Sentence2: I have several options for you; do you prefer African, Asian, or British food? Sentence3: Any sort of food would be fine, as long as it is a bit expensive. Could I get the phone number for your recommendation?Question: Who has spoken the sentence 2? (A) User (B) System
Positive Examples.explanation: The sentence 1 is said by a user because the intent of it says that the information has to be gathered from the system

Positive Examples.input: Sentence1: Guten Tag, I am staying overnight in Cambridge and need a place to sleep. I need free parking and internet. Sentence2: I have 4 different options for you. I have two cheaper guesthouses and two expensive hotels. Do you have a preference? Sentence3: No, but I'd really like to be on the south end of the city. Do any of those fit the bill? Sentence4: Sure. Does price matter? We can narrow it down and find exactly what you need. Question: Who has spoken the sentence 4? (A) User (B) System

Instances.input: Sentence1: I'm also looking for a train. It should depart Cambridge after 14:15 and arrive in Norwich on friday. Sentence2: I have a 3 star hotel and a 4 star hotel both in the centre. Would you like to book one of them? Sentence3: I'm looking for a hotel to stay at. I want it to be at least 2 stars and in the center of town. Sentence4: TR8314 departs Cambridge at 14:36 and arrives in Norwich at 15:55. Would you like me to book a ticket for you? Sentence5: 1 ticket on TR8314 has been booked. Your total is 17.6 GBP, which you can pay at the station. Your Reference number is : H0JS8RMF . Sentence6: I am not finding a 2 star in the centre. Are you sure there is not another type of hotel you would like? Sentence7: Do you have anything that is 2 star rated in the centre? Sentence8: YES PLEASE. FOR 1 PERSON. Sentence9: I have 2 options - one is cheap and one is expensive. Which price range would you prefer? Sentence10: Thank you for calling. Have a great day! Goodbye. Sentence11: I do need a place to stay, so are there any 4 star hotels available? Sentence12: we got none. can i help you with anything else? Sentence13: That is all I need. Sentence14: cheap will work. can you book it for Wednesday? 1 person, 2 nights. I'll need the reference number too. Sentence15: Thanks, that was all I needed today. Goodbye. Sentence16: I was able to book a room at Alexander bed and breakfast, your reference number is VWF48IZM . Is there anything else I can help with? Question: Who has spoken the sentence 12? (A) User (B) System
